title: Showery conditions to enhance in south-western part of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showery condition is expected to be enhanced in the Southwestern part of the country up to some extent from today (12) evening.

title: Hamas to release US-Israeli hostage as part of efforts to reach Gaza ceasefire
byline: Hamas says it will release Israeli-American hostage Edan Alexander, who is believed to be the last living captive with US nationality in Gaza, as a part of efforts to reach a ceasefire agreement.

title: Buddha’s message of peace remains ever-relevant: President Dissanayake
byline: In his Vesak Day message, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake called on the public to build a prosperous nation rooted in selflessness, equality and social justice, fulfilling the aspirations of the people for a “A Thriving Nation – A Beautiful Life.”

title: US, China hail ‘constructive’ Geneva trade talks, details due Monday
byline: The U.S. and China ended high-stakes trade talks on a positive note on Sunday, with U.S. officials touting a “deal” to reduce the U.S. trade deficit, while Chinese officials said the sides had reached “important consensus” and agreed to launch another new economic dialogue forum.

title: Sri Pada Pilgrimage season draws to a close
byline: The Sri Pada Pilgrimage season which commenced on the Unduwap Full Moon Poya Day on December 14, 2024 will officially conclude following religious observances.

title: Vesak season a time to heal hearts and minds of humanity - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya emphasized that in Sri Lanka, where people of diverse ethnicities and religions coexist in harmony, the collective celebration of a major religious festival such as Vesak stands as a powerful testament to that unity.

title: 8,742 ‘Dansal’ registered for Vesak season; Derana’s 24-hr ‘Dansala’ gets underway at 7pm
byline: A total of 8,742 ‘Dansal’ have been registered across the island, in line with the Vesak Day celebrations, the Public Health Inspectors’ Union has confirmed.

title: Thousands of devotees flock to Bodh Gaya amid tight security
byline: Thousands of devotees from several countries including Sri Lanka have been visiting Bodh Gaya since the early hours of today to offer prayers and pay homage at the sacred Mahabodhi Temple on the auspicious occasion of Lord Buddha’s 2569th birth anniversary.

title: Taliban suspends chess over gambling concerns
byline: The Taliban government in Afghanistan has banned chess until further notice due to fears the game is a source of gambling.

title: Sri Lanka’s remittance inflow at $646mn in April
byline: Sri Lanka has recorded an 18.3% increase in workers’ remittances from January to April 2025 compared to the same period in 2024, according to latest figures released by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL).

title: British govt to tighten immigration rules
byline: Migrants will have to live in the UK for a decade before they can apply for citizenship under plans to reduce reliance on foreign workers.

title: 388 prisoners pardoned for Vesak Poya
byline: A total of 388 inmates have been released from prisons across the island today (May 12) under a special state pardon granted by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake in view of Vesak Poya Day, the Department of Prisons has announced.

title: US and China agree to slash tariffs for 90 days
byline: US and China have agreed a temporary cut to the tariffs they impose on each other’s imports.
